titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Chinese subject collection
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Linda Bernard, Pruda L. Lood, Xiuzhi Zhou, and Yinxue Zhang

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-12-08T10:40-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Description is in English and Chinese

change.item: December 8, 2017: Added access copy April 10, 2017: Revised to add detailed description of microfilm reels after microfilm cabinet inventory by Elizabeth Phillips. May 2, 1016: Added description of map case folders in incremental materials 2013. February 21, 2014: Added incremental materials from East Asia vault, "Chinese miscellany" envelopes. November 19, 2013: Added incremental materials inventory. October 15, 2013: Added incremental materials note. July 30, 2012: Revised to update encoding and add unitid label="Collection Number" countrycode="US" repositorycode="CSt-H" by Jill Golden. May 19, 2011: Updated box ranges and date for increment. March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Chinese subject collection)//EN" "reg_047.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.unittitle: Chinese subject collection

physdesc.extent: 13 manuscript boxes, 1 cubic foot box, 4 oversize boxes, 3 oversize folders, 4 scrolls, 19 sound discs, 1 sound cassette, 10 microfilm reels

did.abstract: Reports, memoranda, correspondence, pamphlets, clippings, bulletins, messages, appeals, questionnaires, press releases, maps, silk embroidered portraits, memorabilia, and sound recordings relating to political, social, and economic conditions in China, especially during the period of the Civil War, and to the Tiananmen Square massacre of June 1989.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Chinese subject collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Reports, memoranda, correspondence, pamphlets, clippings, bulletins, messages, appeals, questionnaires, press releases, maps, silk embroidered portraits, memorabilia, and sound recordings relating to political, social, and economic conditions in China, especially during the period of the Civil War, and to the Tiananmen Square massacre of June 1989.

did.unittitle: Subject File,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprised of maps, printed matter, and correspondence pertaining to Chinese history, arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Miscellany,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of a brochure depicting the Astor Hotel in Tianjin where Herbert Hoover is said to have lived and worked.

did.unittitle: General,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Maps depicting sections of Szechwan and Hopeh provinces, as well as miscellaneous intelligence reports, pamphlets, clippings, bulletins, and notes relating to Japanese intervention in China, and to political, social, and economic conditions in China.

did.unittitle: Consortium,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda relating to the formation of a consortium of American, British, French, and Japanese banking groups to conduct commercial activities in China.

did.unittitle: Sino-Japanese Conflict (1937-1945)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlet relating to atrocities committed by the Japanese Army in Shanghai.

did.unittitle: World War II,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Composed of pro-Allied Chinese propaganda materials. Includes copies of four national anthems and one "international" song circulated by the Communists in Yenan.

did.unittitle: Civil War,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comprised of reports relating to economic reconstruction and cooperative movements in the border region area of China under communist control. Includes directives, agreements, and press releases relating to U.S. efforts to mediate between Nationalist and Communist forces.

did.unittitle: Manchukuo,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript memoir of the granddaughter of Tsien Wei-hsia, the prime minister of Manchukuo.

did.unittitle: Issue of China Press,
Nationalists,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Purported translation of a forged special friendship pact between the Chinese People's Republic and the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics. First circulated among pro-Nationalist groups in Hong Kong.

did.unittitle: Pamphlet,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Issued by the Communist Party and relating to the role of Chinese workers in the industrialization of China.

did.unittitle: Program and menu,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to the state visit of Chou En-lai to Burma.

did.unittitle: Pamphlet,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to the gradual disappearance of free creative writing in Communist China.

did.unittitle: Pamphlet,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to the bureaucracy in Communist China.

did.unittitle: Issues of China Connection,
Tiananmen Square Massacre (June 1989)
Appeals and questionnaires prepared by Amnesty International,
Electronic bulletin board messages,
Transcript of a taped personal account,
Booklets,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to the ten-year reform movement.

did.unittitle: Memorabilia,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a portfolio of Buddhist silk embroidered portraits, dating from the Chien-lung period of the Ch'ing dynasty, as well as two Nationalist Chinese flags.

did.unittitle: Audiovisual File,
Sound discs,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 19 sound discs relating to Chinese revolutionary history, including mutual aid teams, policy towards marriage reforms, Sino-Soviet friendship, Mao Tse-tung, and Lu Hsun.

did.unittitle: 2015 Incremental Materials,
DAZIBAO big character poster (大字报),

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The big character poster titled, "Some Complaints about the Leaders of the Ministry," was created by the staff of the Thirteenth Bureau under the Chinese Ministry of Public Security during China's Cultural Revolution (1966-1976). The Thirteenth Bureau was in charge of Qincheng Prison, China's maximum-security political prison, that incarcerated previously influential political figures. During the Cultural Revolution, there was vehement factional fighting in the Thirteenth Bureau.
大字报作者为中华人民共和国公安部下属的十三局的员工。十三局即公安部下属的预审局，负责管理专门关押中华人民共和国高级官员的秦城监狱。文化大革命期间，公安部十三局两派斗争激烈。

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is composed of a four-part poster in which the staff of the Thirteenth Bureau, under Chinese Ministry of Public Security, expressed their discontent with their leaders, criticizing them as being arbitrary and suppressing democracy. Sun Pengfei, the vice director of the Bureau, was mentioned in the poster as being inefficient in promoting the Cultural Revolution within the Bureau. In addition, the authors considered the leaders of the Ministry of Public Security to be failures in listening to the voices of the ordinary staff in the Thirteenth Bureau and thus advocated that leaders to visit the Bureau more often. In the last section of the poster, the signatures of the 33 staff members of the Thirteenth Bureau are evident.
该大字报共有四页，根据内容推测创作于中国文化大革命（1966－1976）时期。该大字报主要表达了中华人民共和国公安部下属的十三局员工对领导阶层的不满，认为局领导专横无礼、压制民主。其中，十三局副局长孙鹏飞被点名批评。同时，该大字报认为公安部高层对十三局重视不够，导致文化大革命在局内无法彻底进行。大字报中要求公安部领导对十三局领导加以监管，并且多聆听群众呼声。
